item.title: Simulating Multivariate Normal by Univariate Normal
item.description: library(knitr) opts_chunk$set(tidy.opts=list(width.cutoff=60),tidy=TRUE) Univariate to Multivariate \[\begin{align} \vec{y} = \sum_i \vec{v}_i \mathcal{N}_i \nonumber \end{align}\] , where \(\mathcal{N}_1, ..., \mathcal{N}_p\) are independent standard univariate normal. Then \[\begin{align} \vec{y} \sim \mathcal{N}(\vec{0}, VV^T) \label{eq:mvn} \end{align}\] , where \(V = [\vec{v}_1, ..., \vec{v}_p]\). Example In the following example, \(v_i \in \mathbb{R}^2\) and \(p = 2\). The number of simulated samples is \(B = 10000\). Ploting contour in R # draw contour of a multivariate normal distribution library(mvtnorm) drawContour <- function(xgrid, ygrid, mu, sigma) { z <- c() x <- c() y <- c() for (i in 1:length(xgrid)) { for (j in 1:length(ygrid)) { z <- c(z, dmvnorm(c(xgrid[i], ygrid[j]), mean = mu, sigma = sigma)) x <- c(x, xgrid[i]) y <- c(y, ygrid[j]) } } return(data.
